dublin_core.dcvalue: An emerging consensus supports online communication between patients and physicians in an existing relationship to improve the quality timeliness and efficiency of medical care Patients are also seeking medical care online from physicians they have never met ranging from one time interactions for a second opinion to psychotherapy These practices call for a new regulatory paradigm to ensure accountability establish acceptable parameters for online medical practice and distinguish online health care delivery from online health information The new patient physician encounters also challenge the medical profession and society to reexamine core assumptions that define medical practice and the patient physician relationship
Made available in DSpace on 2020-02-12T11:51:34Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 0 Previous issue date: 2002-07-15
Between strangers: the practice of medicine online.
